related:
  - title: "AI models are powerful, but are they biologically plausible?"
    excerpt: "Researchers hypothesize that a powerful type of AI model known as a transformer could be implemented in the brain through networks of neuron and astrocyte cells. The work could offer insights into how the brain works and help scientists understand why transformers are so effective at machine-learning tasks."
